definition: (conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

sentences.english: Unprincipled concessions in diplomacy led to a crushing failure in real politics.
sentences.chinese: 外交上无原则的让步导致政治上一场毁灭性的失败。

sentences.english: He never gets involved in unprincipled disputes.
sentences.chinese: 他从不介入无原则的争端。

sentences.english: However, I do not always unprincipled concessions.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我不会永远无原则的让步。

sentences.english: Unprincipled accommodation will do harm to him.
sentences.chinese: 无原则的迁就对他有害。

sentences.english: You should refrain from  unprincipled argument.
sentences.chinese: 你应当克制自己不要作无原则的争论。

sentences.english: Always very easy to forgive a person, not principle.
sentences.chinese: 总是很容易原谅人，毫无原则。

sentences.english: It is the unprincipled implementation that the distribution without master plan is implemented.
sentences.chinese: 没有总体规划的分布实施是无原则的实施。

sentences.english: Changes in the law were railroaded through parliament by unprincipled politicians.
sentences.chinese: 他从不介入无原则的争端。

sentences.english: He never gets involved in unprincipled disputes.

definition: everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
excessively tolerant/to overindulge (sb)/overly conciliatory/to seek appeasement at any price
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
